Note to Implementers: FHIR Capabilities

Any FHIR capability may be 'allowed' by the system unless explicitly marked as "SHALL NOT". A few items are marked as MAY in the Implementation Guide to highlight their potential relevance to the use case.

FHIR RESTful Capabilities

Mode: server

An empty Capability Statement

Security
Enable CORS: yes
Security services supported: SMART-on-FHIR

This is the Capability Statement to declare that the server supports SMART-on-FHIR. See the SMART-on-FHIR docs for the extension that would go with such a server

Summary of System-wide Interactions

name: Base FHIR Capability Statement (Empty)
description: This is the base Capability Statement for FHIR. It represents a server that provides the none of the functionality defined by FHIR. It is provided to use as a template for system designers to build their own Capability Statements from. A capability statement has to contain something, so this contains a read of a Capability Statement

security.description: This is the Capability Statement to declare that the server supports SMART-on-FHIR. See the SMART-on-FHIR docs for the extension that would go with such a server
